abstract: With political pressure mounting, Senate Republicans relented on Wednesday and agreed to let Democrats open debate on legislation that would impose the most far-reaching overhaul of the nation’s financial regulatory system since the aftermath of the Depression.
snippet: With political pressure mounting, Senate Republicans relented on Wednesday and agreed to let Democrats open debate on legislation that would impose the most far-reaching overhaul of the nation’s financial regulatory system since the aftermath of t...
lead_paragraph: With political pressure mounting, Senate Republicans relented on Wednesday and agreed to let Democrats open debate on legislation that would impose the most far-reaching overhaul of the nation’s financial regulatory system since the aftermath of the Depression.

headline.main: Republicans Allow Debate on Financial Overhaul

abstract: GSC Group, a little-known investment firm from New Jersey, was contacted by Goldman Sachs in January 2007 and asked to find mortgage-backed securities for the bank’s C.D.O. deal, which now lies at the heart of the S.E.C.’s case against the firm, The Wall Street Journal said. GSC refused.
snippet: GSC Group, a little-known investment firm from New Jersey, was contacted by Goldman Sachs in January 2007 and asked to find mortgage-backed securities for the bank’s C.D.O. deal, which now lies at the heart of the S.E.C.’s case against the firm, T...
lead_paragraph: A little-known investment firm has found itself caught up in the Securities and Exchange Commission‘s fraud case against Goldman Sachs, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: One Firm Refused to Aid a Goldman C.D.O. Plan
